snippet: The launch hinges on approval by the Federal Aviation Administration, which is reviewing SpaceX’s investigation of the Sept. 1 launchpad explosion....
abstract: Iridium Communications says it will soon launch first batch of next-generation satellites on SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket; announcement comes three months after SpaceX rocket exploded in Cape Canaveral, Fla, destroying $200 million Israeli satellite; upcoming launch must be cleared by Federal Aviation Admin, which is currently reviewing company's investigation of September disaster.
lead_paragraph: The launch hinges on approval by the Federal Aviation Administration, which is reviewing SpaceX’s investigation of the Sept. 1 launchpad explosion.

headline.main: 3 Months After Explosion, SpaceX Plans to Launch Rocket Bearing Satellites
headline.print_headline: 3 Months After Explosion, SpaceX Plans to Launch Rocket Bearing Satellites
